update.description:
This PR allows for complete primary and secondary integration, with syncronous stepping of all of the secondaries.

It additionally distributes the “performer affinity”, which assigns which performers will be simulated on particular secondaries in the network graph.

There is currently a performance regression in the interaction with the LevelManager system that I am working to resolve.
update.title: [A-3] Distribute performer affinities.

content.raw: It was to keep it from printing every step, which ended up flooding the console.  Will add a comment.
content.html: It was to keep it from printing every step, which ended up flooding the console. Will add a comment.

content.raw:
Can you add a comment here. I'm not sure why there is a `% 1000`.
Is this just to rate limit the debug  statements?
content.html: Can you add a comment here. I'm not sure why there is a % 1000. Is this just to rate limit the debug statements?

content.raw: Do you want the topic name scoped to the world?
content.html: Do you want the topic name scoped to the world?

content.raw: Just curious why you removed this and the following `IGN_PROFILE`.
content.html: Just curious why you removed this and the following IGN_PROFILE.

content.raw: Remove?
content.html: Remove?

content.raw: "Levels and distributed simulation will not work"
content.html: "Levels and distributed simulation will not work"

content.raw: Note to change this if/when pull request #200 gets in.
content.html: Note to change this if/when pull request #200 gets in.

content.raw: I'll take a deeper look at this tomorrow. If we don't get to this tomorrow, then it can be included in a patch release.

content.raw: Parti**ci**pant
content.html: Participant

content.raw: And here [auto newPose = msgs::Convert(poseMsg)](https://ignitionrobotics.org/api/msgs/3.0/namespaceignition_1_1msgs.html#ae8a1f10dfa5b3102e7fd569ab6c261fb)
content.html: And here auto newPose = msgs::Convert(poseMsg)

content.raw: You could use [msgs::Set(poseMsg, pose)](https://ignitionrobotics.org/api/msgs/3.0/namespaceignition_1_1msgs.html#a492aff4ca6816a2f20208d81a6b6b053)
content.html: You could use msgs::Set(poseMsg, pose)

content.raw: It looks like the `SyncManager`, like the `NetworkManager`, performs quite different actions for primaries and secondaries. No action needed now, but in the future we could consider splitting this class into 2 like the network manager is split.
content.html: It looks like the SyncManager, like the NetworkManager, performs quite different actions for primaries and secondaries. No action needed now, but in the future we could consider splitting this class into 2 like the network manager is split.

content.raw: You could use `ignition::msgs::Entity`, which includes name, ID and type
content.html: You could use ignition::msgs::Entity, which includes name, ID and type

content.raw: How about not even creating the `SyncManager` if distribution is disabled?
content.html: How about not even creating the SyncManager if distribution is disabled?

content.raw: A few includes can be removed here
content.html: A few includes can be removed here

content.raw: Missing some brief and returns
content.html: Missing some brief and returns

content.raw: Should this file be in the `network` dir?
content.html: Should this file be in the network dir?

content.raw: Some of these includes, like `sdf` and `set`, can be removed
content.html: Some of these includes, like sdf and set, can be removed

content.raw: The profile string could be a bit more descriptive
content.html: The profile string could be a bit more descriptive

content.raw: `{` in new line
content.html: { in new line

content.raw: The sync manager only needs to be created if `UseDistSim` is true, right?
content.html: The sync manager only needs to be created if UseDistSim is true, right?

content.raw: I think the `else` block can be removed
content.html: I think the else block can be removed

content.raw: We should be [avoiding abbreviations](https://google.github.io/styleguide/cppguide.html#General_Naming_Rules), so how about `UseDistributedSimulation`, or `Distributed`?
content.html: We should be avoiding abbreviations, so how about UseDistributedSimulation, or Distributed?

content.raw: Missing doxygen
content.html: Missing doxygen

content.raw:
Instead of a bool component, it could have `NoData` and its presence indicate that it's active.

Also, the documentaion needs updating
content.html:
Instead of a bool component, it could have NoData and its presence indicate that it's active.

Also, the documentaion needs updating

content.raw: Document this message.
content.html: Document this message.

content.raw: This commented out code can be removed.
content.html: This commented out code can be removed.

content.raw: :eyes:

I've had a new segfault appear in `UNIT_Server_TEST` after merging with Default.  I’m assuming it’s another interaction between the SyncManager and the LevelManager.  Currently trying to run that to ground.  An initial pass for review would also be helpful.
content.html: I've had a new segfault appear in UNIT_Server_TEST after merging with Default. I’m assuming it’s another interaction between the SyncManager and the LevelManager. Currently trying to run that to ground. An initial pass for review would also be helpful.

* Wiring Distributed Simulation in with simulation server.
* Async stepping.
* Distribute affinity and syncronize poses.
* Distributed sim benchmarking worlds.
